snippet: A platinum producer suspended operations, and tear gas was fired at protesting workers at a gold mine in signs that spreading turmoil is destabilizing a crucial industry.
abstract: Labor riots gripping South Africa’s mines spread prompting the world’s largest platinum producer to halt production at a number of its mines and guards to fire tear gas on protesting workers at a major gold mine; unrest, which was sparked by the police killing 34 miners at a platinum mine in Marikana in August, threatens to destabilize one of the most important industries in Africa’s biggest economy.
lead_paragraph: A platinum producer suspended operations, and tear gas was fired at protesting workers at a gold mine in signs that spreading turmoil is destabilizing a crucial industry.

headline.seo: South African Labor Unrest in Mining Deepens
headline.main: In South Africa, Labor Unrest in Mining Deepens
headline.print_headline: In South Africa, Labor Unrest in Mining Deepens
